intro: Heteropsis obliqua, commonly known as the narrow-leaf heteropsis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Malvaceae family, with adaptations suited to its native habitat. Heteropsis obliqua is often found in moist, shaded environments, contributing to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
